intro: [WRONG START] Hieracium cottetii subsp. hawelkaa, commonly known as Hawelka's hawkweed, is a perennial herb native to the alpine regions of Central Europe. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its erect, hairy stems and yellow composite flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and compact inflorescence. It thrives in rocky and grassy habitats at high altitudes. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and protected species in many regions.
